abstract: Banco Bilbao Vizcaya Argentaria, Spain’s second-biggest bank, agreed to buy Compass Bancshares for $9.6 billion to gain a greater foothold in the consumer-lending market in the southern United States. The Spanish bank is offering Compass shareholders $71.82 in cash or 2.8 new BBVA shares for each Compass share. The offer represents an 8.2 percent premium to Compass’s closing price yesterday of $66.37. Speculation about an imminent bid sent Compass shares up $4.59, or 7.4 percent, Thursday.
